A4.text: before going to the well-regarded University of Edinburgh Medical School with his brother Erasmus in October 1825

A5.text: then immediately caught the train to London and their new home

A6.text: Down House is a village 23 km south-east of London's Charing Cross.

A7.text: Charles and Emma moved to Down House in 1842, a village in Kent.

A8.text: Down House is the home of Charles Darwin.

A10.text: After a brief period of residence in London, they moved permanently to Down House.
